txt.en: 'Now then... let's eat!'
Instance: The Want-kin
'Fascinating, [placeholder]. There's still so much of the world for us to see!'
'This way, [placeholder].'
'I was hungry, Nagli. What else was I to do?!'
'Well, I haven't had anything yet....'
'What do you say, [placeholder]?'
'And neither have I!'
'No. I've got no appetite tonight....'
'Tell us tales of your adventures, won't you?'
'Yes, that was quite the tale!'
'Finished, are you? Might I have a word, [placeholder]?'
'To have walked the Black Land and lived to tell the tale... now that is impressive!'
'It is hard to believe we travelled so free of conflict with all that was going on!'
'Ah, it seems Lapis's supper made her quite tired. Let's not disturb her dreaming!'
'Nonsense!'
'Oh? And what do you mean by that, St贸rath?'
'I've heard more than enough talk of battle, hardship, and tragedy.'
'Your hollow glories do not impress me, [placeholder]. Only trouble follows in your wake!'
'What is the meaning of this, St贸rath? [placeholder] does not deserve this rudeness!'
'[placeholder] has brought war to the Slade! All that we hoped to leave behind has found us again!'
'Oh, St贸rath, I don't think you believe that....'
'Will you be joining us at the fire tonight, St贸rath?'
'Whether or not we choose to involve ourselves in the battles of our time, they still must be fought.'
'I'm sorry to hear it, my friend. If you change your mind, we've more than enough for you.'
'It is true that we left our lands of old in search of peace and new beginnings, but others are not so fortunate.'
'If not for folk like [placeholder], what would become of those in need?'
'Bah.'
'And now we are all settled. Good!'
'I'd like to welcome [placeholder] to our supper tonight, and thank them for...'
'Gaustaf! You've already eaten everything on your plate!'
'Thank you, my friends. At least you can share a supper with us!'
